answer: The expansion of the Borel transform of a QCD amplitude near the infrared renormalon can be used to improve the accuracy of perturbative expansions, as seen in the analysis of the Adler function (hep-ph/0101297).
explanation: This paper demonstrates how the expansion of the Borel transform near the infrared renormalon can be used to constrain the Borel amplitude and improve the accuracy of perturbative expansions.
